The resulting pMIRB-HA-NPM3 plasmids (both sense and antisense orientations) were transiently transfected into NIH 3T3 cells, using transfection conditions with Lipofectamine and OptiMEM serum-free medium (Gibco-BRL, Bethesda, MD) as described [ 49 ] . Following a six-hour incubation of the DNA-Lipofectamine complexes in OptiMEM, the cells were washed and incubated in 10-cm dishes with their usual growth media (DMEM with 10% v/v fetal calf serum, 2 mM L-glutamine, 100 Units/ml of Penicillin G and 100 μg/ml Streptomycin) for 48-72 hours at 37°C in humidified 5% CO 2 incubators.
